Prvi obisk pri veterinarju
Vsak, še posebno pa prvi obisk veterinarja naj bi bil za žival prijeten in čim manj stresen, da bo tudi v prihodnje pogumno prestopala vrata ambulante.
02 Nov 2019, 15:01 by Katja Zdovc*



GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTOTudi veterinarjev cilj je, da je za žival prvi obisk v ambulanti čim manj stresen. Fotografiji: Guliver/Getty Images



GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTOMuco na veterino vedno prinesemo v zaboju.


Novi družinski ljubljenček v vašem domu vas nedvomno razveseli, hkrati prinese tudi določene obveznosti, o katerih se je priporočljivo pozanimati pri izbranem veterinarju.


Muco na veterino vedno prinesemo v zaboju.GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTO

Pri prvem obisku v ambulanti bo veterinar vašega ljubljenčka najprej temeljito pregledal, nato pa se boste pogovorili o tem, kaj vse je treba zanj urediti. Vsaka žival dobi kartoteko, kamor se bodo vpisovali vsi nadaljnji obiski, rezultati pregledov in morebitna zdravljenja. 
Označitev in registracija
Označitev z mikročipom in registracija sta za vse pse obvezni. Mladiček mora biti označen do tretjega meseca starosti. Številka mikročipa, ki ga veterinar vstavi pod kožo na levi strani vratu in se lahko odčita s posebnim čitalnikom, služi za prepoznavanje živali. Pod to številko se namreč psa vpiše v centralni register, kamor se zapiše tudi podatke njegovega lastnika. Ob tem se za kužka izda tudi potni list. Za registracijo mladička potrebujete številko mikročipa njegove mame ter svoj osebni dokument.
Obisk pri veterinarju, zlasti prvi, naj bo za žival prijetna izkušnja.1. Mikročipiranje in redno cepljenje proti steklini je obvezno za vse pse.2. Za mačke mikročipiranje ni obvezno, razen če z njo potujete v tujino.3. Z veterinarjem se pogovorite tudi o pravilni skrbi za žival.
Če ste dobili psa, ki je že označen in ima veljaven potni list, je v prvem tednu treba urediti le še spremembo lastništva, za kar potrebujete izjavo o spremembi, ki jo mora podpisati tudi prejšnji lastnik.Za mačke mikročipiranje ni obvezno, razen če z njo potujete v tujino. Vsekakor se označitev priporoča, še posebno pri mačkah, ki imajo omogočen izhod iz hiše, saj se jo, če se izgubi, veliko lažje in hitreje prepozna ter vrne lastniku. 
Cepljenja
Pri prvem obisku vam bo veterinar razložil protokol obveznih in priporočljivih cepljenj. Običajno je pasji mladiček najprej cepljen proti kužnim boleznim. Ob tem se opravi splošni klinični pregled, s katerim se veterinar prepriča, da je žival zdrava in primerna za cepljenje. Med dopolnjenim tretjim in četrtim mesecem starosti pa mora biti prvič cepljen proti steklini.Oskrba živaliČe ste prvič postali lastnik živali in z oskrbo še nimate veliko izkušenj, je obisk pri veterinarju tudi odlična priložnost, da se pogovorite še o pravilni negi (čiščenje zob, krajšanje krempljev), o primerni prehrani in, če se odločate tudi o tem, o možnosti sterilizacije in kastracije.To je za pse obvezno in mora biti opravljeno redno prva tri leta, nato pa vsako tretje leto. Vsako cepljenje se vpiše tudi v potni list, kamor vam bo veterinar napisal še datum naslednjega cepljenja.Pri mačkah se najbolj priporoča redno cepljenje proti kužnim boleznim in mačji levkozi. Cepljenje proti steklini zanje ni obvezno, razen če boste z njo potovali v tujino. 
Odprava zajedavcev
Pri vsakem psu in mački, še posebno pri mladičkih, je priporočljiva še skrb za zaščito pred notranjimi in zunanjimi zajedavci. Najbolj učinkovito odpravljanje notranjih parazitov, kot so gliste in trakulje, je z rednim dajanjem tabletk za razglistenje, za zaščito pred bolhami, klopi in drugimi zunanjimi paraziti pa obstaja več možnosti (tabletka, ovratnica, ampula), o katerih se lahko pogovorite z veterinarjem.*Katja Zdovc je dr. vet. med.

First visit to the vet
Each, and especially the first visit of the veterinarian, should be pleasant for the animal and as stressful as possible, so that it will continue to cross the ambulance door in the future.
02 Nov 2019, 14:01 by Katja Zdovc *



GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTOThough the veterinarian's goal is to make the animal's first visit to the infirmary as stressful as possible. Photos: Gulliver / Getty Images



GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTOM We always bring veterinary medicine in a crate.


A new family pet in your home will undoubtedly make you happy, but it also brings with it certain obligations that it is advisable to inquire with your chosen veterinarian.


We always bring our pussy to the vet in a crate.GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTO

On your first visit to the outpatient clinic, your pet's veterinarian will first have a thorough examination and then discuss what needs to be done. Each animal is provided with a file to record all follow-up visits, examination results and possible treatments.
Marking and registration
Microchip identification and registration are required for all dogs. The puppy must be marked by the age of three months. The microchip number that the vet inserts under the skin on the left side of the neck and can be read with a special reader is used to identify animals. Namely, under this number the dog is entered in the central register, which also contains the information of its owner. A passport is also issued for the puppy. To register a puppy, you need his mother's microchip number and your ID.
Visiting a veterinarian, especially the first one, should be an enjoyable experience for the animal.1. Microchipping and regular rabies vaccination are mandatory for all dogs.2. Microchipping is not mandatory for cats unless you are traveling abroad.3. Also talk to your vet about proper animal care.
If you have a dog that is already marked and has a valid passport, only a change of ownership is required during the first week, which requires a declaration of change, which must also be signed by the previous owner. you are traveling abroad. However, the marking is recommended, especially for cats that are allowed to leave the house, because if lost, it is much easier and faster to identify and return to the owner.
Vaccinations
At your first visit, your veterinarian will explain the protocol for mandatory and recommended vaccinations. Usually, a puppy is first vaccinated against infectious diseases. A general clinical examination shall be carried out to ensure that the veterinarian is healthy and fit for vaccination. During the third and fourth months of the age, he must be vaccinated for rabies for the first time. Care of animalsIf you are the first owner of an animal and do not have much experience with care, a visit to the vet is also a great opportunity to talk about proper care (teeth cleaning, shortening (claws), appropriate nutrition and, if you decide, the possibility of sterilization and castration.This is mandatory for dogs and should be done regularly for the first three years, and then every third year. Each vaccination should also be entered in a passport, to which the veterinarian will write you the date of the next vaccination. Regular vaccination against infectious diseases and feline leukemia is recommended in cats. Rabies vaccination is not mandatory for them unless you are traveling abroad.
Elimination of parasites
Care is needed in every dog and cat, especially in puppies, for protection against internal and external parasites. The most effective elimination of internal parasites such as earthworms and tapeworms is the regular administration of pill for decomposition, and to protect against fleas, ticks and other external parasites, there are several options (pill, collar, ampoule) that can be discussed with a veterinarian. * Katja Zdovc is dr. vet. med.
